column4: i have a second display set up through nvidia-settings - it doesn't work.  the screen is black, but when I move my mouse to the other screen I can see the pointer on the second screen.
ok which nvidia card specifically and which driver version
gtx260/driver 180.
also when you open nvidia-settings and go to xserver display configuration are both monitors shown?
do you have a background image on the desktop?
i do not.
ok  first open a terminal  and paste this     glxinfo -l |grep MAX_TEXTURE_SIZE
just tell me the max texture size on the readout
oo nice  you really shouldnt have too much issue with max texture size then
in terminal   lspci | grep -i vga
since i can move my pointer over there at all - and because it worked flawlessly in both 8.10 and the same install dist-upgraded to 9.04 - it isn't a hardware issue.
no but I wanted to check exact card version before searching
are you setting the dual monitor manually via nvidia-settings?
and you do need to run this as twinview
yes.  although, again.  i'm using a known good con-
no, i do not.  twinview is not what i'm looking for.
ok then you will have some issues with separate xscreens  and I never use separate xscreens so I wont be able to trouble shoot this
this is apparent.  thank you anyway.
although with twinview  windows will open only on the primary monitor  until you drag them to seondary monitor
they will also maximize only on the primary
that can be changed in xorg.conf
again.  you don't understand the problem.  evidently i have come to the wrong place.
